p: In 83% of patients with MERS coronavirus infection, initial radiography will show some degree of abnormality, with ground-glass opacities being the most common finding [ 14]. Likewise, CT will show bilateral and predominantly ground-glass opacities, with a predilection to basilar and peripheral lung zones, but observation of isolated consolidation (20%) or pleural effusion (33%) is not uncommon inÂ MERS [ 15].
